fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13032].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The Epic and Story description are wrong on the help page.
* <instance-url>/secure/ShowConstantsHelp.jspa?decorator=popup#IssueTypes

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In the instance click to create an issue;
# On the right side of Issue Type click on the help button.

h3. Expected Results
Shows the right description.

h3. Actual Results
||Issue Type||Description Shown||
|Epic|gh.issue.epic.desc|
|Story|gh.issue.story.desc|
|Bug|jira.translation.issuetype.bug.name.desc|

It also shows these incorrect strings on the Issue Types page in administration.
fields.summary: Description for Epic and Story are not showing on Issue Types or help page

fields.description: The progress bars beneath each epic on a rapid board only count the hours of the completed tasks within towards to progress, not the remaining estimated time.
fields.summary: Epic progress bars on Rapid Board do not include work in progress

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When you select more than one quick filter in JIRA Agile, the parameter "AND" is added to the filter.
However if you have different quick filters, each one bringing a different project (since you can have many projects in a board), it doesn't work if you select more than one quick filter. The JQL will be something like "project = Project1 AND project=project2", which is not valid in JQL.

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to filter for different projects in a board but being able to select more than one.
fields.summary: Ability to use quick filters for different projects

fields.description:
Original summary: {{As a user I want to search on Sprint start and end dates.}}

h3. Problem Definition
As a user I can see that the JIRA issue shows the Sprint information as well as the end dates on the issue. 
!Screen Shot 2016-01-07 at 13.25.45.png!

However, I would also like to be able to search for Sprint start and end dates on jql.
This feature is currently not available.
fields.summary: Ability to see Sprint start and end dates in search results in issue navigator

fields.description:
The kanban is used to visualize the progress we make during a sprint. Like many software development teams, we have QA verify every issue before closing it. So the workflow is: an issue starts open. A developer marks it in progress. The developer checks in a fix and marks it resolved. QA verifies a subsequent build and marks it closed.

We want to visualize this flow with four columns in the kanban board. That works fine unless you use this version widget, which has the limitation we discussed below. To workaround the version widget problem, we have to use only 3 columns, so we can't visualize the difference between resolved and closed, which makes us less effective.
fields.summary: Add ability to use additional column to visualize resolved vs closed issues on kanban board

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, Adding issues into sprint requires Edit issue permission. This is applied for both active sprint and planned sprint

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to separate permission for active sprint and planned sprint. This would be helpful in the following scenario:
We want to restrict user to add or move issues to active sprint , but they should still be able to add issues or move issues in future sprint and backlogs.
fields.summary: Having a separate permission for Active sprint and Planned sprint

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Script error is shown while opening Release Burndown report on Firefox or Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Open a sofwtare project using the browsers Firefox or Internet Explorer 11
# Click on "Reports" icon
# Select "Release Burdown"

h3. Expected Results
Report opens without errors

h3. Actual Results
!Screen Shot 2016-01-07 at 4.08.37 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workarounds
* Try using Chrome
fields.summary: Script error while opening Release Burndown report
Sprint Health Gadget - Assignee duplicates due to capitalization

fields.description:
Sorry for my english

One thing that I see in almost all projects like this is a lack of automation on epic/us/task/sub-task conclusion automation.

When you have a US with Tasks and those Tasks have Sub-tasks you will/should only work on the Sub-tasks and all the other should never have any really work to do. So when all the Sub-tasks are DONE the related Task should be automatically moved to DONE too. The same related to when all Tasks are DONE, US should me automatically moved to DONE. And the same for Epics, of course.

Does this make sense to you?
fields.summary: EPIC, US, TASK auto-DONE when all child issues are DONE

fields.description: As a JIRA and Bitbucket integration user, I would prefer not to be redirected to Bitbucket every time I click to Create Branch, but I would like to have it open in a new tab, so I can continue in the issue page.
fields.summary: Clicking 'Create branch' link from a JIRA ticket should not navigate me away from JIRA to Bitbucket website.

fields.description:
Sorry for my english :)

One thing that I see in almost all projects like this is a lack of automation on epic/us/task/sub-task conclusion automation.

When you have a US with Tasks and those Tasks have Sub-tasks you will/should only work on the Sub-tasks and all the other should never have any really work to do. So when all the Sub-tasks are DONE the related Task should be automatically moved to DONE too. The same related to when all Tasks are DONE, US should me automatically moved to DONE. And the same for Epics, of course.

Does this make sense to you?
fields.summary: EPIC, US, TASK auto-DONE when all child issues are DONE.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Currently, it's not possible to get the administrator of the of the board through REST API
* https://docs.atlassian.com/greenhopper/REST/cloud/

h3. Suggested Solution
* Ability to get the administrator of the board through JIRA Agile (Software) REST API
fields.summary: Ability to get the details of the administrator of the board through JIRA Agile (Software) REST API

fields.description:
1. I am trying to get my Jira license key and when I try to view it, it asks for a server ID. Where do I find that?

2. When I try to view the documentation on installing in a VMware environment I get the following error:
 
Page level restrictions apply to this page. These restrictions limit access to specific users or groups.
fields.summary: Couple of questions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13004].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Viewing the Backlog with an empty sprint shows "An Error occurred" on screen:
!Screen Shot 2016-01-04 at 3.07.04 PM.png|thumbnail! 

*Note:*
* The error doesn't affect the backlog and can be disregarded.

h3. Environment
* JIRA v7.1.0-OD-03-048
* JIRA Agile v7.1.10-D20151209T034204
* JIRA Agile v 7.1.11-D20160106T005545
* JIRA v7.2.0-OD-04-029
* JIRA Agile v7.2.3-D20160316T002614
* OSX and Windows
* Firefox
* Internet Explorer
* Chrome Browser (sometimes the error is displayed on screen and sometimes in the browser console)


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Sample Scrum Project.
# Create a quick filter with jql "project = <project key>"
# Navigate to Backlog.
# Notice that there is already an active sprint
# Create an empty sprint.
# Apply the above created quick filter and refresh the page.

h3. Another way to Reproduce

# Have a board and create a new Story in _Backlog View_

h3. Expected Results
Board loads without error

h3. Actual Results
The following error occurs in the UI:
{code}
An error occurred
Hide…

Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.
Details

        Exception: Script error.
        Resource: https://d2p4ir3ro0j0cb.cloudfront.net/<INSTANCE_NAME>.atlassian.net/s/7f6ff4107231bec8ba4595df86c97ca2-CDN/en_US-lyyi7f/71001/92a2ec46d1f53aa12621c7f48091ee7b/d9e265262e3f625277854f2bb2159604/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,atl.general,gh-rapid,jira.global,jira.project.sidebar,jira.general,-_super/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true
        Line: 0
        Column: 0
{code}
also appears with error:
{code}
Cannot read property 'getIssueList' of null
{code}
 
h3.Workaround
* Dismiss to hide the error. It will re appear when refreshing the Backlog page.
* Use a different browser
fields.summary: Backlog Exception: Script error getIssueList

fields.description:
When viewing a project backlog I would like to drag and drop issues into versions and have them add to, not replace, already existing versions. 

It's weird JIRA supports the functionality for an issue to belong to multiple versions but doesn't allow you to stack them in this manner. We use versions for release planning and major milestones so it's very common for issues to belong to several. It's not efficient to have to add the second version one at a time from the issue view and would help us work much faster to do this from the backlog. 

It recently caused some trouble too as the override/replace action for a few issues went unnoticed and someone else thought the version was finished because those issues were missing.
fields.summary: Allow multiple Versions when dragging and dropping from backlog

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The entire top half of the page is wasted space with too much padding.
 !space.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
 Lesser padding for better usability
fields.summary: Wasted screen space in headers

fields.description:
h4. Summary

When an issue is moved to an Empty Sprint/Backlog in the backlog mode of a Scrum board, the Rank value of the issue is unchanged because there's no issue to be compared with it the Sprint/Backlog where it's moved to. However, this is not documented anywhere.

h4. Suggestion

This should be documented clearly, otherwise confusion might be encountered when one views the board's filter query in Issue Navigator, in which the order of the issues might not be the same top-down order as what he/she sees in the backlog mode. A KB article has been created for this at:
* [Why an issue's Rank value is not changed when moved to an Empty Sprint/Backlog|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=794371351]
fields.summary: Document how Ranking works when issues are moved to an Empty Sprint/Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Add a simplified way to restrict visibility on a Kanban board, making users able to see only the swimlanes their group should.

h3. Use Case Example

We use swimlanes to organize the requests by department, and would like to have the ability to only allow people from a given department to see that department's requests. In other words, tweak the visibility of the swimlanes. The team should be able to see all the swimlanes, the departments should be able to see only their one swimlane. I guess we could set up a number of boards, set filters, and give access to boards to do the same thing, but it would be more elegant to have one board that adjusts per the user department.
fields.summary: Restrict visibility for swimlanes on a Kanban Board

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
As JIRA Agile is bundled in JIRA Software, then it is not possible to disable JIRA Agile features, such as Boards. In some cases, user is using JIRA Software only for its development features, without having to work with JIRA Agile feature, such as Boards

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to disable JIRA Agile features in JIRA Software
fields.summary: Having the option to disable JIRA Agile features in JIRA Software

fields.description:
As an engineering executive, I'd like an Epic Burndown Gadget so we can track progress across many epics via Dashboards or Confluence Report Pages.

*_Additional Comments:_*
_Atlassian has really under invested in Gadgets and Dashboards.  For example, I've been waiting literally years for you to add the ability to have Story Points as the "value" field for the two dimensional filter.  Similarly, when you redesigned Jira and added the Reports section, all reports should have been made available as Gadgets via Dashboards.  For any meaningful implementation, its inefficient to have to go to each project/board to view reports.  Dashboards/Gadgets are a very powerful capability.  I'd think improving this area would be low effort/high reward._
fields.summary: Epic Burndown Gadget

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, some actions in JIRA Agile will trigger pop up notification. For example:
* Every time user move issue in/out of Sprint will trigger pop up message on scope change. 

For users that are familiar with this behavior, they find it unnecessary to be shown every single time the action is performed. 

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to turn off the pop up notification.
fields.summary: Having the option to turn off pop up notification for JIRA Agile

fields.description:
Very often, I receive this error when browsing to the agile boardsAn error occurred
Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.DetailsException: 

Uncaught TypeError: Brace.noConflict is not a functionResource: https://findit.wkfs-frc.com/s/cd89b26c8ff4b168a09bed1915a53f17-T/en_UKj978lc/6332/185/f29587b61dd68072c1e78ccf8c35d713/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,atl.general,gh-rapid,jira.global/batch.js?locale=en-UK&isAdmin=true&jag=true&jaguser=trueLine: 4170Column: 97EnvironmentMozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/44.0.2403.107 Safari/537.36Stack traceTypeError: Brace.noConflict is not a functionat https://findit.wkfs-frc.com/s/cd89b26c8ff4b168a09bed1915a53f17-T/en_UKj978lc/6332/185/f29587b61dd68072c1e78ccf8c35d713/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,atl.general,gh-rapid,jira.global/batch.js?locale=en-UK&isAdmin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true:4170:97at main (https://findit.wkfs-frc.com/s/4e1fa13f36dddb6a0b3ba6b99c9a1e0d-CDN/en_UKj978lc/6332/185/83/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js?locale=en-UK:349:3721)at callDep (https://findit.wkfs-frc.com/s/4e1fa13f36dddb6a0b3ba6b99c9a1e0d-CDN/en_UKj978lc/6332/185/83/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js?locale=en-UK:349:1812)at main (https://findit.wkfs-frc.com/s/4e1fa13f36dddb6a0b3ba6b99c9a1e0d-CDN/en_UKj978lc/6332/185/83/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js?locale=en-UK:349:3534)at https://findit.wkfs-frc.com/s/4e1fa13f36dddb6a0b3ba6b99c9a1e0d-CDN/en_UKj978lc/6332/185/83/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js?locale=en-UK:349:4435
fields.summary: Error While browsing Agile Boards

fields.description:
h5. Summary
JIRA's little introduction thing when I land on the agile board for the first time invites me to "fill my team's backlog with issues." This suggestion sits beside a graphic that looks like like nothing else on the screen and gives no indication of "how" I'm meat to do that.

Screenshot attached.

h5. Suggestion
Add a more intuitive element on the interface to indicate where or how can JIRA users create a story
fields.summary: Nothing on the screen looks like this help text icon

fields.description: This would allow for more controlled deployments based on tags through services polling git like Jenkins..
fields.summary: As a JIRA User when I release a version, I would like JIRA to apply a git tag with the version name to branch in a repo i select from the SCM manager.

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

When running a JQL (specifying to show the _Sprint_ column) into the issue navigator filtering for only _opened sprints_ assuming that issue 'X' is inside an opened sprint (Sprint A) and another closed sprint (Sprint B). The column results will show both Sprint A and Sprint B.

If issue 'X' is only inside closed sprints. No results will appear.

This can be very confusing when using gadgets (e.g: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics) to fitter opened sprints, as it will show closed sprints and this is not the expected behavior.
fields.summary: Results should clearly identify sprint status when filtering for opened sprints where an issue is also associated to closed sprints

fields.description:
We have been using Jira Agile/Kanban for many years now. We recently decided that the Agile board should really be ordered first by priority, then rank within the priority. We also use swimlanes based on Epics, to organize our current features at the top.

This means that stakeholders priority tickets are pushed to the top of our Kanban board view, which helps us plan out the most important work.
In other words, the agile board shows tickets in the same order as stakeholder priority, and works well:
project in (MyPrac, PWS) ORDER BY priority DESC, Rank ASC

Currently Jira does not allow  "Move to Top" or drag and drop tickets vertically in the Agile view, even though it does allow "Rank to Top" on individual tickets. (When viewing the as in: 
https://issues.practichem.com/browse/MyPrac-1234)
Steps to reproduce:
# Set up a Kanban board with a filter containing: ORDER BY priority DESC, Rank ASC
# In the view, attempt to drag and drop the ticket vertically to adjust rank.
# Or, Click on the ticket, observe that the side panel shows more ticket information on the right, then click on ... for additional actions, and then click "Move to Top"
# Observe that Jira does not adjust the rank, and that it displays an error:
# Ranking is disabled, as the Filter Query for this board is not ordered by ascending Rank. Please check your filter configuration.
# Expect that Jira moves the ticket to the top of the rank within the given priority. I'd be fine with a warning, if you want. 

There isn't any real reason to block the re-rank completely, since this is a scenario where we are using "atypical" queries. When people do use these ordering schemes, Jira should still allow the adjustment, as much as possible.

Since Rank is still relevant, and still part of the query (Rank ASC), I should be able to change the rank within a priority. (Rank to Top vs Move to Top). 
Of course, I don't expect that drag and drop or "Move to Top" should affect priority. Without this, organizing rank of tickets becomes quite tedious.
fields.summary: I should be able to adjust rank within Jira Agile, even if my query first orders by priority, then by rank

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

It is not currently possible to configure the default settings for Card Layout and Estimation Statistic. Users sometimes forget to add certain fields on the board.

h3. Suggested Resolution

It would great to have this option so that user can set the default fields for Card Layout/ default Estimation Statistic.
fields.summary: Provide Card Layout and Estimation Global Configuration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to remove an issue from the active sprint, the issue is removed from the active sprint but there's error on the UI which is misleading.

{code}
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'selectIssue' of undefined
Resource: <BASEURL>/s/737d7fd572306b9452889a42d93c3b5d-CDN/en_USz3wepa/71010/b6b48b2829824b869586ac216d119363/fdae415d434dbc349a175aa0357d6560/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,atl.general,gh-rapid,jira.global,jira.project.sidebar,jira.general,-_super/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&is-server-instance=true&is-system-admin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-acknowledged=true&nps-not-opted-out=true&sd_licensed=true
Line: 135974
Column: 52
{code}

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud Version: {{7.1.0-OD-02-030}}
* JIRA Server: {{7.1.x}}
* Chrome browser
* Firefox browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Scrum project.
# Create 5 new issues.
# Create a new sprint, start the sprint.
# Go to *Active sprints* page, right click on any issues and choose *Remove from sprint*.

OR
# Create a new issue and assign it to an active sprint.
# Go to the *Active sprints* page, right click on any issues and choose *Remove from sprint*.

h3. Expected Results
The issue is removed from the sprint without any errors

h3. Actual Results
The issue is removed from the sprint but throws an error in the UI
!Screen Shot 2016-03-09 at 12.36.48 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
If issue can be removed from sprint without any errors on the UI, please try to *refresh the Active Sprint page* before trying to remove an issue from sprint, or copy the *Active Sprint* link and open it in a new browser window, and proceed with removing an issue from sprint.
 
h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Getting an error when removing an issue from Active Sprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-12983].
  {panel}

*Summary*
JIRA keyboard shortcut blocking default browser's modifier key *Alt* in Firefox(Linux).

Disabling JIRA keyboard shortcut won't release this modifier key.

*Current behavior*
While browsing Kanban board, key 1, 2 and 3 are for changing between the tabs in the board. Holding modifier key *Alt* + 1, 2 or 3 will trigger the same shortcut.

*Expected behavior*
# Holding *Alt* shouldn't be treated as the same shortcut key.
# Disabling JIRA keyboard shortcuts should disable it completely and any browser's default shortcuts should be usable.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut blocking default browser's modifier key

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Sprint suggested naming does not take in account that the number listed could be a date range. 

Example: 

Sprint 1 12/31 - 1/06 (user entered)
Sprint 2 1/07-1/29 (user entered)
Sprint 2 1/07-1/30 (JIRA suggested)
Sprint 2 1/07-1/31 (JIRA suggested)
Sprint 2 1/07-1/32 (JIRA suggested)
etc....

h3. Suggested Solution

Create smarter sprint naming. Similar to this feature request for naming: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5125. A good feature would allow user to select *Create Sprint* and the sprint number would advances as well as date range (following the previous sprint's date trend)


h3. Workaround 

Current workaround is to manually change the Sprint name when creating one to fit naming convention used in previous sprints.
fields.summary: Better Sprint Auto-Naming for Creating a New Sprint with Dates in Title

fields.description:
I would like to JIRA remember the last selected quick filter when opening a board.

Actually, after select a quick filter if you return to the board after moving to a different page the board will display the default filter and not the last selected quick filter.
fields.summary: I would like to JIRA remember the last selected quick filter when opening a board.

fields.description:
It would be great to have ability to edit certain certain fields on the detail view of an issue on Agile Board.
Being on agile board,  I would like to change priority and assignee to each issue. It is a good feature to have on agile board.
fields.summary: Ability to edit certain certain fields on the detail view of an issue on Agile Board.

fields.description:
When I move a card from one coloumn to another I would like to be able to drop it in between other cards to designate it's priority within that coloumn.

At the moment I can't do this as all cards disappear when I drag a card from its source coloumn to another coloumn.

Once dropped, the card seems to have a rank value that determines where it ends up in the coloumn and I subsequently have to search to find it (annoying orange).
fields.summary: Ability to rank a card when transitioning to another column

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When using the Jira Software, user want to filter the issue assigned to a particular number of users by clicking on the user's portrait in the board/backlog

h3. Suggested Solution
As a admin and user :
# I should be able to click on one or many user portrait in the board/backlog to filter on that person.
# When I clicked on the user icon, it should be marked in the UI (maybe with a blue frame around it) so that I can see what users I am filtering on.
# I should able to click on a portrait to filter on it, that user marked shall be ADDED to any Quick filters already in effect.
# I should able to "unclick" a "selected" user thus removing that user from the filter.
# The Agile board should show the user pictures in the Agile board that works in the same way as in the backlog.
fields.summary: Able to filter by clicking on the user portrait in the board/backlog

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Version report in *Release Hub* shows issues of "In Testing" in "In Progress" status.
!Screenshot1.jpeg|width=1000!
As shown in Screenshot1, it's quite confusing when different statuses are shown in the same column and doesn't make sense.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be nice if users can add more columns based on the status, but not status category.
fields.summary: Allow Custom Columns in Release Hub

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the [CFD documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/using-a-board/using-reports/viewing-the-cumulative-flow-diagram] doesn't explain how the values to the chart are being generated. This explanation can better help the customer understand the factors that would affect the chart and would be able to better utilize the chart accordingly. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Explanation of how the Cumulative Flow Diagram populates so that the users get a better understanding of this.
fields.summary: As a User, I want the Documentation of Cumulative Flow Diagram to explain how the chart is being calculated

fields.description:
Provide a way to configure JIRA Scrum Boards so that when clicking a ticket number on the board, for example:

+FOO-345+

Takes you to the full ticket detail screen directly rather than the right-side vertical pane opening. It's something that is driving our team nuts.  That right vertical pane is pretty useless.
fields.summary: Scrum Board: configuration to change behavior of clicking on ticket number link

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
Actually when the Epic Link field is added to a screen, it will show the only the epic name which an issue is related to.

h5. Suggestion
Epic Link field should show the epic key and the epic name, instead of only its name.
fields.summary: Epic Link field should also show epic key on an issue screen

fields.description:
Intermittent Time out error coming in Opening / Refreshing / any updates to JIRA ticket through Agile KANBAN Boards, 

JIRA ver 6.4.11
fields.summary: Intermittent Time out error coming in Opening / Refreshing / any updates to JIRA ticket through Agile KANBAN Boards,

fields.description: This is an important confidentiality issue. There are some data that shouldn't be disclosed to other users, (without the necessary permissions) and should remain accessible only for certain users.
fields.summary: Users shouldn't be able to Browse a Sprint from other Boards without Project Permission

fields.description:
*Current Behavior*
When clicking on the Sprint on the Agile board, it will display all issues of the sprint

Requested Behavior*
Allow user to set a default quick filter such *Only My Issues* so that it will only display users' issues when clicking on the sprint.
fields.summary: Ability to set a default quick filter when opening a Sprint

fields.description: If a Jira User Story has subtasks the status of the User Story itself is not displayed on the board. In order to see the User Story status you need to actually open the User Story record. We would like to see the User Story status displayed on the bar for the User Story (this is the way it worked in the older version of Jira).
fields.summary: We would like to see the User Story status displayed on the bar for the User Story (this is the way it worked in the older version of Jira).

fields.description:
Srs,

I have a project with two screens calls Comments and "Descrição da Soluçao". In Comments by default, i can change the permission of preview (Viewable for all users or by groups). Is there some possibility to insert the same permission in "Descrição da Solução", So the administrator is alble to define who can visualize this issue.?.
fields.summary: including same comments permissions in another screen

fields.description:
Agile reports ignored initial story point once it is cleared from Done issues if there's no other issue history earlier on rather than the history for clearing story point.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Create 3 issues *A*, *B* and *C* with story point set to 1, 2 and 3 respectively.
* Create a sprint in the project's Scrum board.
* Before adding the issues into the sprint, edit the story point for issue *A* and *C* to 3 and 1 respectively (*A* with 3 points and *C* with 1 points now).
* Drag the issues into the sprint and start it.
* Drag the issues to Done in the Scrum board and complete the sprint.
* Check the reports e.g. burndown chart and velocity chart. Total story point should be 6.
* Now, edit those 3 issues and remove their story point or set it to 0.
* Check the charts again and total will be 4. Story point for issue *B* where there's no change to story point is considered as empty in the charts but not for *A* and *C*.

Note: The action of clearing story point after issues set to Done is to reflect the same *Update from date* action via JIRA Porfolio. This is an action that will be performed in JIRA Portfolio frequently.
fields.summary: Agile reports ignored initial story point once it is cleared from Done issues

fields.description:
In the Project Releases page there are two quick filters, Released and Unreleased.

!172266.png|thumbnail!

As a user I would like to add new quick filters to this page and/or change the quick filters query.
fields.summary: Allow customization of the project releases page quick filters.

fields.description:
My understanding of an *Epic* is very different to my understanding of a *Theme*. I would define these as:

_An *Epic* describes a number of *Stories* all of which must be delivered in order to gain the benefit described by the *Epic*. Or to put it another way, all *Stories* in an *Epic* would be delivered into a live environment at the same time because they have limited value in their own right._

_A *Theme* describes a common goal or idea which applies to many *Stories*. All of the *Stories* within an *Theme* are independent of the *Theme*. That is to say, the *Stories* do not all need to be delivered together._

This can be achieved to an extent in JIRA using the labels field or a custom 'Theme' label field to record *Themes*. However it does not allow us to record any detail about the *Theme*.

This can also be achieved by using an *Epic* as though it were a *Theme*. But this prevents a *Story* from being in both a *Theme* and an *Epic* because the *Epic Link* only allows one *Theme*. The other problem is that a *Theme* isn't really an issue type, in that it would never want to be closed, you don't deliver a *Theme* but you do deliver an *Epic*.

I believe *Themes* should be catered for in JIRA very differently to a normal Issue. I have yet to find a satisfactory lo-fi solution to this. I therefore believe *Themes* should be introduced as a top level concept into JIRA.
fields.summary: Introduce Themes separately from Epics

fields.description:
In this issue https://jdog.jira-dev.com/browse/JC-778. Usage of that key is being removed from Jira Core so there is no need for Software to keep setting it.
Currently the key is being used in com/atlassian/greenhopper/service/properties/UserPropertyServiceImpl.java (get & set)

If Software itself is using it that usage should be removed, you can read about strategies here https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/2015/11/25/Session+removal+learning+for+zero-downtime+upgrades
fields.summary: Remove usage of SessionKeys.USER_HISTORY_ISSUETYPE httpsession key

fields.description:
Having the ability to set constraints on the different columns for controlling the WIP and flow through the process is a good thing, however, with a mid-sized team of around 10 people, I'd really like the option of making the constraint values on a column be "Per-user" constraints.  If it could be adjustable for each column on the board, so much the better.  Currently if I set the MAX constraint to "N" (Number of team members), assuming WIP for each user should be 1, then if a user has 2, but the value is still under "N", the constraint would not be violated, even though the intended constraint is being breached.  

There might also need to be some changes made on how that user shows up in the swimlanes/columns, so this may be more than just a simple change.

I hope this is clear, but if not, please contact me at mark.galbraith@citrix.com for clarification.
fields.summary: Allow per-user constraint configuration on Kanban/Scrum boards

fields.description:
The 'Flagged' field isn't available to be placed on a Card Layout. This is unfortunate because I've extended the Checkbox-type field with additional values and I'd like to see them represented on the issue.

This is in JIRA Cloud so scripting add-ons are unavailable.
fields.summary: As a user I'd like to place the Flagged field on a Card Layout

fields.description:
Original summary {{Show estimates for bugs and story-points for everything else in backlog}}
---
As a project administrator who is scheduling tasks, it is important to see bug estimates different than story points in the backlog. 

Prerequisites:

-Requires administrator login to board

Steps:
1. Click 'Board' dropdown
2. Click 'Configure' menu item
3. Select 'Estimation' from left-side configuration
4. Change 'Estimation Statistic'

Results:
- There is no item that can have bugs show as estimates and other types as story points

Expected result:
- A selection that allows for the bugs to show 'estimates' in the backlog - while leaving 'Story Points' for all other task types
fields.summary: Ability to show different estimate types on different issue types

fields.description:
h3. Summary
According the documentation:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2015/12/jira-software-sprint-management-first-release
{quote}
As previously blogged, we're now shipping the first release of the Manage Sprints permission changes on 6th December 2015. With the first release, the Manage Sprints permission will be created, and existing users with the Administer Project permission will be assigned the new permission for the same projects. The same sprint actions will check for the new permission, so it will be business as usual.
The following sprint-related actions will now be assigned to specific users in your team, thereby separating these from the actions that come with the Administer Project permission:
* Creating sprints
* Starting sprints
* Completing sprints
* Editing sprint information (sprint name and dates)
* Reordering sprints  (currently only future sprints)
* Deleting sprints (currently only future sprints)
* Reopening sprints
* Moving the sprint footer
{quote}

Users should now be able to manage Sprints, this include Starting and completing sprints, by only having this new implemented permission: "Manage Sprints" permission.
However, some users who have both "Manage Sprints" and "Administer Projects" are not being able to fulfil any of the actions above unless they are also *"JIRA Administrators"*, a permission that shouldn't be needed.

h3. Environment
JIRA Agile Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board and a new project;
# Create a user with only Manage Sprints permission on this project;
# Try to start the Sprint with this user.

h3. Expected Results
Having the *Manage Sprints* permission should be enough to enable the user to complete the actions described above.

h3. Actual Results
Even with *Manage Sprints*, *Edit Issue*, *Schedule issue* and *Administer Projects* over all projects retrieved by the board's filter, the user can't start/complete

h3. Workarounds

*Suggested*
* Provide user "Manage Sprint" permission across all permission schemes

*Alternatives*
* Create another temporary board without any sub query Eg: {{Project = TEST order by RANK ASC}}, create the sprint there. Use quick filter to filter the fields instead. 
* To start sprint, get administrator to initiate the sprint at this moment.
* Provide a user "JIRA Administrator" Global Permission to Start/Stop any sprint
fields.summary: Cannot start/close sprint since latest Cloud release

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

Project admin unable to create sprint or stop sprint, below error is seen:
{noformat}
You need the Manage Sprints permission for all the projects in the origin board to create a sprint
{noformat}

When you have filter query of labels that span across other project where the same user is not a project administrator of. This happen despite having the filter constructed with project specific, for more information refer to the steps to replicate below.

h2. Steps to replicate

# Create 2 projects with 1 issue each on the project (Project A and Project B)
# Create a label (example of the field) and mark it on the issue for both project (example: {{labeling}})
# Grant the user for test project administration and manage sprint permission of project A
# Ensure that the user have no such permission for project B
# Create a board with query below:
{noformat}
project = "Project A" and labels in (labeling) ORDER BY Rank ASC
{noformat}
# Load the board for test user that follow the criteria given for step 3 and step 4

h2. Expected result

User able to create sprint, since the filter should only return issues from project A

h2. Actual result

User unable to create sprint, error is seen

h2. Workarounds

*Suggested*
* Provide user "Manage Sprint" permission across all permission schemes

*Alternatives*
* Create another temporary board without any sub query Eg: {{Project = TEST order by RANK ASC}}, create the sprint there. Use quick filter to filter the fields instead. 
* To start sprint, get administrator to initiate the sprint at this moment.
* Provide a user "JIRA Administrator" Global Permission to Start/Stop any sprint

h2. Affected Version

{{7.1.8-D20151201T145156}} Detected on JIRA Software Cloud
fields.summary: User with permission not able to Start Sprint or Stop Sprint when Sub Query contain issue from different project

fields.description:
Allow the negation of a quick filter without copying or modifying the quick filter.
Example quick filter "Bugs" JQL: _type = Bug_
Just allow *three state* of a *quick filter*:
1. {color:#707070}Not Active{color} --> JQL: ""
2. {color:#14892c}Active{color} --> JQL: "_type = Bug_"
3. {color:#d04437}Active negation{color} --> JQL: "_NOT type = Bug_" - Adds a "NOT " to the JQL of the quick filter.
fields.summary: Provide negation ("not") in quick filter (agile board)

fields.description:
Original summary: {{Link to Issue Navigator from version page gives unreadable query}}

In JIRA 7.0, the version screen provides a series of tabs across the top for "Issues In Version", "Issues Done", "Issues in Progress", etc.

When on one of those issue listings, there is a link right above the table for "View in Issue Navigator". However, when that happens, the query it takes you to is in "Advanced" mode where it displays the raw JQL and the Basic button is greyed out. In addition, it utilizes the numeric IDs for project/version. For example, if I click that link when on the "Issues in Version" tab, I get:
project = 10020 AND fixVersion = 12960 ORDER BY priority DESC, key ASC

This makes it very hard to then further refine the query.

This is in contrast to the "good" query you get when you are on an issue page for an existing issue and click on the version number. It uses the Basic view, and the URL shows that the query used the NAMES of the project and versions.
fields.summary: Version page to Issue Navigator link query should be readable or use Basic search

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a JPO Plan
# Tries to access the plan 

*Expected Results:*
The plan would load normally.

*Actual Results:*
A blank page shows up. On the web inspector we can see the following:
{code}Uncaught QuotaExceededError: Failed to execute 'setItem' on 'Storage': Setting the value of 'radiantminds.roadmap.plan-3.reports-releases.activeView' exceeded the quota.{code}

*Workaround:*
# Go to chrome://settings/cookies
# Search for the plan URL
# Find "local storage", click remove

*Notes:*
Browser: Chrome version 44.0.2403.130 (64-bit)
Similar case: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-32634
fields.summary: JPO becomes unusable when chrome local storage quota is exceeded

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Epic report should allow a display of remaining hours sorted by epics

h3. Environment
Server / Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an open sprint
# Run the {{Epic Report}}

h3. Expected Results
The option to show each epic with remaining hours only should be selectable

h3. Actual Results
This is not possible
fields.summary: Report on Estimated hours by Epic

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JIRA software, a non-JIRA user can only view features that JIRA Core users see meaning, they can view issues in any type of project, but they won't be able to see any application-specific features, such as boards.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow anonymous access for JIRA Agile features when *Browse Project* [project permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/managing-project-permissions-185729636.html] is granted to group *Anyone*.
fields.summary: Ability for non-JIRA user to access JIRA Software features

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description
Full load Agile Board in IE 11 lasts for 17 seconds, load that same Board in Google Chrome takes 5 seconds, in Firefox takes 6 seconds.

h3. Steps to Replicate
Use JIRA Agile 6.7.11
Use Internet Explorer v11.0.9600.18059
Use Google Chrome v46.0.2490.86
Use Mozilla Firefox v37.0.2
Create 30 test boards
Visit the same Agile Boards on IE11, Chrome and FF and compare load time.
Populate the project that associated with the board with Epics and Versions. The more element here will slow down IE11 even further.

h3. Expected Result
Agile Board loading time will be about the same on all browsers.

h3. Actual Result
Loading IE11 is too slow.

How dramatically speed up loading Agile Boards in IE 11?
fields.summary: Slow loading Agile boards in IE11

fields.description:
Whilst you can customise an agile board to include the current issue status in the backlog row, this causes the row to become two lines, and makes it hard to read.

It would be good to be able to show the current status of the issue in the main backlog row, so that I can see quickly which issues near the top of the backlog need progressing before they can be taken into sprint.
fields.summary: Show issue status lozenge in backlog row

fields.description:
Currently, one of my team's workflows has a circular process for approval by an external team (IE. In Development -> Awaiting Approval -> In Development, and so on.). These statuses both are part of an "In Progress" column on the board, so there's no easy way to drag and drop to change the status for this process, only to move forward.

Is it possible to change the status in the detail view for the board to an interactive field which would allow any available workflow transition?
fields.summary: Allow Status Change in Detail View when viewing an Agile Project's Board

fields.description:
This has been requested many times, can someone tell me if there has been a viable solution?
This is a very simple ask, not sure why being ignored by Atlassian..?
fields.summary: Quick filter by ANY assignee on the RapidBoard

fields.description: It would be good if users could choose if issues removed from a Sprint will count or not on the Commitment value of the Velocity Report.
fields.summary: Update Commitment on Velocity Report When Issue is Removed From Sprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-12898].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

Selecting any _Quick Filter_ on board A, navigate to board B and go back to board A again, it used to remember the _Quick Filter_ selection. However it is currently not working as of the latest Cloud Release.

h3. Steps to Replicate

# Create 2 test boards
# Navigate to board A and select {{Only My Issues}} quick filter
# Navigate to board B
# Go back again to board A

h3. Expected Result

{{Only My Issues}} quick filter is remembered and selected.

h3. Actual Result

{{Only My Issues}} quick filter is not selected.

h3. Workaround

Manually select/click {{Only My Issues}} quick filter
fields.summary: Quick filter is not remembered after navigating to another board

fields.description: When working on smaller screens it would ease getting an overview if it was possible to hide columns. When using the Quick Filter "Hide done" for example, there is no need to see the entire width of the Done column when nothing is showing in it. In the same way, it would be useful to be able to collapse or hide other columns, not relevant at the moment for a particular user.
fields.summary: Hide Columns in Active Sprint View

fields.description:
For notification and query reporting purposes, it would be very useful to be able to query the end date of the current sprint in order to have filters which would send notifications or give reports as the end of the sprint is drawing near.   

Example:  Using jira notification assistant based on a JQL query to send a reminder for all remaining issues assigned to you which are not completed a few days before a sprint ends.
fields.summary: Ability to query (JQL) end date of current active sprint

fields.description:
h3.Summary
When you try to access an older version report for example {{https://ATLASSIAN_URL/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=219&projectKey=TEST&view=reporting&chart=versionReport&version=23000}}, it will not load the report for version 23000 but instead the browser will redirect the link to {{https://ATLASSIAN_URL/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=219&projectKey=TEST&view=reporting&chart=versionReport&version=23801}} (which is the latest).

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Load an older version report from your browser

h3.Expected Result
The older version report is loaded correctly.

h3.Current Result
The older version is not loaded; instead the URL redirects to the latest version report.

h3.Workaround
The older version reports can be accessed via the version drop down list but cannot be accessed directly from the URL. 

h3.Note
This happens in JIRA Agile 7.1.7 but I can't find it at the affects version field.
fields.summary: Reloading an older version report URL redirects the page back to the latest version report

fields.description: jira 7.0.2 link github  not dvcs plug
fields.summary: jira 7.0.2 to github

fields.description:
JIRA v6.3.8, JIRA Agile v6.6.13
1. Go to project Overview>Versions (or project Administration>Versions) and observe a release date for certain version (in my example on the screenshot1.jpg it will be 22/Jan/15)
2. Go to appropriate Agile board where this release will be represented, expand versions from the left, and observe the date of the same release 
---
Release date will be shown one day back (in my example on the second screenshot2.jpg it will be Release Date: 21/Jan/15)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
We simply need to make JIRA's "Default user time zone" mismatch with Java's recognized "System Default". Let's assume the current Java "System Default" is: America/Los_Angeles (GMT -7)

h5. Reproduce 1
# Create a new Agile board, using the Sample Scrum Project
** This will automatically include versions with release dates
# Within JIRA, modify JIRA Administration > System > General Configuration > Default user time zone
# Change the region to "Australia" and "GMT +8"
# Now compare the version dates on the Agile Board vs. the Project administration page - notice that they are a day off

h5. Reproduce 2
# Modify the JVM parameters to include: {{-Duser.timezone=Australia/Perth}}
# Restart JIRA and compare versions

h3. Workaround
Ensure that both "Default user time zone" and JVM timezone match
fields.summary: Version's date is shown one day off on agile board>versions

fields.description:
Currently, a person is allowed to manage a sprint (start/stop them, add/remove issues, etc.) if they have the required combination of project permissions in all projects "visible" to a sprint. While [#GHS-5035] will change how these permissions are structured, the permissions are still entirely governed by whether the user has permissions in a particular project or set of projects. This means there is no way for sprints/boards/teams that work on the same project(s) to be unable to manage sprints that are not from their board. This causes several problems:

# Because only one sprint on a board can be open at a time, two teams working on the same project cannot work in separate sprints. I admit that this is not very "Scrum" but it is a *huge* problem for us. The current restrictions do not prevent work being done on the same project in different sprints anyway, you just need to have a second project on each board that differs between the two teams, i.e. Team 1 can work on Projects 1 and 2 while Team 2 work on Projects 2 and 3, but not if they both work only on Projects 1 and 2. N.B. There is a setting in JIRA Software Labs that can allow parallel sprints, please keep this feature!
# Issues can easily be added to the wrong sprint, and users are presented with many sprints they should not have to see when choosing a sprint.
# In our company we turn over a large number of small projects (one of the main reasons we have cross-functional teams that can collaborate on any specific project). Maintaining project-specific board filters for each board would be very complex and time consuming and very prone to issues getting "lost" if assigned to a user using a board that does not reference the relevant project, and nowhere near as elegant as an "assignee in membersOf(...)" type filter which is all that should be necessary for a team-centric board.

My argument is that Scrum boards and their associated sprints do not fundamentally map to a set of projects, they map to a particular team. In "pure" Scrum, a team works on a single project, and so there is an implied mapping from sprint to project which would mean project permissions would be sufficient to control who can manage a given set of sprints. However, JIRA Software is no longer called JIRA Agile and "Scrum" boards are based on any JQL query not on a list of projects, so I do not accept the notion that they are solely intended to be used with unique project mappings.

Hence, I believe there are two types of permission that need to be available:

* Issue-based permissions that decide whether the user can add *that* issue to *any* sprint. These are the permissions that are currently in place.
* Board-based permissions that decide whether the user can add *any* issue to *that* sprint. These are the permissions I would like to have implemented.

Some solutions that would be fine for us:

# Add a requirement that someone managing a sprint (starting/stopping/deleting/adding/removing/etc.) should not only have the project permissions already in place, but must also be an administrator on the "origin board" (see [#GHS-5035], [#comment-785773]) for that sprint. 
# Create a separate field on the board ("Scrum Masters" or "Sprint Managers"?) as opposed to using the existing Board Admin.

What would *not* be workable is to do it based on who the board filter is shared with. We need many more people to be able to view a board than to be able to manage it (obviously).

While planning, a user should only see sprints that they are able to manage, and they should be able to start that sprint even if other open sprints visible to the board but with a different origin board (that correspond to other teams working on the same project(s)) exist.
fields.summary: As a Scrum Master, I want to be able to control who has permission to manage a particular sprint.

fields.description:
h4. +Scenario+
[JIRA Agile REST API Reference|https://docs.atlassian.com/greenhopper/REST/latest/] does not contain any info about how to query Agile reports e.g. Velocity or Burndown.

However, there are available endpoints to achieve this, e.g.:
* for Velocity:
{code}/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapid/charts/velocity?rapidViewId=<board_ID>{code}
* for Burndown:
{code}/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapid/charts/scopechangeburndownchart?rapidViewId=<board_ID>&sprintId=<sprint_ID>{code}

A full list of report keywords usable for REST endpoints can be found in [this Answer|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/243675/where-are-possible-chart-types-for-the-greenhopper-rest-api-documented].

h4. +Suggestion+
The documentation should be updated with this kind of information.
fields.summary: Update REST API doc with /rapid/charts endpoints

fields.description: Radcliffe Collaborative working with Technology
fields.summary: Collaborative Product Development
Road Map gadget to be visible to anonymous users

fields.description:
The time displayed in control chart for each of the statuses is different from the time that is displayed in Transition tab in issue.
Here is what is displayed in the Transition tab:
 !image-2015-11-25-18-38-08-703.png|thumbnail! 

and here is what is displayed in control chart for the same issue:
 !image-2015-11-25-18-42-06-733.png|thumbnail! 

Only one status matches which affects the lead and cycle time calculations. I am seeing it with all issues where at least one of the statuses doe not match up.
fields.summary: time in status is different in control chart vs Transitions tab in issue

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
Kanban is designed without Backlog, since there is no sprint planning in Kanban. This means that every issues belong to that board will be shown. This could lead to having to load many issues (based on board filter) at one time.

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to limit the number of issues shown in Kanban board at one time. Perhaps based on the due date or priority. This will allow users to focus on working on the prioritized issues, and this will make the board more manageable.
fields.summary: Ability to limit the issues shown on Active Sprint mode of Kanban Board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Looking at the issue ID we can't figure out what issue type it is.

h3. Solution 

To have a pattern according to a issue type to be able to differentiate issue type from issue ID
For example,
ABC-1, can be a Story
ABC-2, can be a Task
ABC-3, can be a Bug
etc.

It would be better if we can have dedicated running ID for each issue type. Instead of one constant pattern to generate issue IDs.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue ID Be Recognizable By Issue Type

fields.description:
When a Kanban board is configured to have Epic Swimlanes, the board might not show all issues, as the only issues shown will match the epics that coincide with the board filter. If not all epics are shown, not all issues will be shown.

The issue caused is that the number above the columns on the board will always show the total number of issues, regardless of the number of issues that are shown after swimlanes are created. This will cause confusion for users, as the total in the column might report 17 issues, while only 5 might be visible based on what the swimlanes and filter show.

I am suggesting that we make that number more accurate when swimlanes are created. For example, a board without swimlanes might show something like "17 out of 17 issues shown", whereas once some issues disappear from the board when epic swimlanes are created, that number might show as "5 out of 17 issues shown" (the wording could of course be different).
fields.summary: Number above Kanban Column Should show Visible vs. Total

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Under the scenario described in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-11709, Release Burndown report may appear to associate issues to sprints that they don't actually belong to.

h3. Suggested Solution
Improve labelling on release burndown report to better reflect the relationship between a release and a sprint.
fields.summary: Improve labelling on release burndown report to better reflect the relationship between a release and a sprint.

fields.description:
When a card (ie. User Story) is displayed in backlog view, and if sub-task are selected in the Board configuration to be displayed, and if number of sub-tasks is greater than a certain number (depending on screen resolution), then not all sub-tasks are displayed. Instead, ellipsis symbol is added after the last visible sub-task.

Accordingly, when this page is printed, only a certain number of sub-tasks is visible, more if page is printed in landscape mode, less if page is printed in portrait mode.

I suspect that it would be beneficial for many users, and certainly very beneficial for us, to have this feature designed in such a way that always all sub-tasks are displayed, by moving excessive number of sub-tasks into second, third, and so on... row.

Please see attached images.

The same would happen when page is printed, all sub-tasks would always be printed, regardless of the number of sub-tasks and paper orientation.


Likely to be related to: [GHS-12416]
fields.summary: Not all sub-tasks are displayed on agile cards, nor printed

fields.description: I often find myself needing a LOT more information about a version that was released or is in development than the one line description field offers.  We need the ability to add fields to the summary that we and others could refer to, so that we could have a TRUE summary of what went into a release.  This information includes links to documentation, SVN revisions for milestones, release dates (beta and final versions), participants, testers, links to test plans... etc.
fields.summary: Allow users to customize version summary page, add fields

fields.description: h3. Summary When viewing the release burndown report there's no data table rendered under the report and the js console has the following error: !image-2015-11-23-16-05-18-110.png|thumbnail! The following JS error pops up in the UI *When using Firefox* {code} Exception: TypeError: issueData104.estimateStatistic is undefined Resource: http:///s/a5c8bb12e9e9b1ccb06c5fea4e819a51-T/en_US53sh9d/70112/038344a3642fd2869d52d7530e380e51/eaa1da2e4cbe4b241293a0b4b70a38c1/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid,jira.project.sidebar,atl.general,atl.global,jira.global,jira.general,-_super/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&isAdmin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US Line: 21353 Column: 307 {code} *When using Chome* {code}Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'statFieldValue' of undefined Resource: http:///s/43b93f60bd443d1f362bda76d725121e-T/en_US-vtgrqy/70111/b6b48b2829824b869586ac216d119363/6442100a4e80b2abad7eb96050d981e6/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid,jira.project.sidebar,atl.general,atl.global,jira.global,jira.general,-_super/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&isAdmin=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US Line: 107797 Column: 560{code} h3. Steps to Reproduce # Setup an Agile Board with estimation in Story Points # Setup an Sprint such that some issue types do not have story points associated with them (ie some are estimated with time). # Schedule and complete the sprint as normal. # View the Release Burndown report. h3. Expected Results The Release Burndown Report renders as normal. h3. Actual Results The report fails, with the error {{Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'statFieldValue' of undefined}}, and the below stack trace: {noformat} TypeError: Cannot read property 'statFieldValue' of undefined at Object.GH.tpl.reports.issueTable.renderIssueTableRows (http://sf-srv-sup-willienelson.office.atlassian.com:8702/ghs27407/s/95b7115a70e3442e7ebea4a2773faf96-CDN/en_US-jn4rf6/70111/b6b48b2829824b869586ac216d119363/d7d13e5ae078c2dac1fd9bebff4c20bf/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid,jira.project.sidebar,atl.general,atl.global,jira.global,jira.general,-_super/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US:89572:560) at Object.GH.tpl.reports.issueTable.renderIssueTable (http://sf-srv-sup-willienelson.office.atlassian.com:8702/ghs27407/s/95b7115a70e3442e7ebea4a2773faf96-CDN/en_US-jn4rf6/70111/b6b48b2829824b869586ac216d119363/d7d13e5ae078c2dac1fd9bebff4c20bf/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid,jira.project.sidebar,atl.general,atl.global,jira.global,jira.general,-_super/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US:89537:829) at Object.GH.tpl.reports.scopeBurndownBySprint.renderIssueTable (http://sf-srv-sup-willienelson.office.atlassian.com:8702/ghs27407/s/95b7115a70e3442e7ebea4a2773faf96-CDN/en_US-jn4rf6/70111/b6b48b2829824b869586ac216d119363/d7d13e5ae078c2dac1fd9bebff4c20bf/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid,jira.project.sidebar,atl.general,atl.global,jira.global,jira.general,-_super/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US:89647:87) at Object.GH.tpl.reports.scopeBurndownBySprint.renderIssueList (http://sf-srv-sup-willienelson.office.atlassian.com:8702/ghs27407/s/95b7115a70e3442e7ebea4a2773faf96-CDN/en_US-jn4rf6/70111/b6b48b2829824b869586ac216d119363/d7d13e5ae078c2dac1fd9bebff4c20bf/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,gh-rapid,jira.project.sidebar,atl.general,atl.global,jira.global,jira.general,-_super/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US:89636:52) {noformat} h3. Workaround # Check the JQL of the filter, to see which issue types are returned. # Ensure all those issue types have the 'Story Points' JIRA Agile Custom Field. h3. Notes Issue is caused by a bug in the soy template: ReportIssueTable.soy {code} ... {if $issue.estimateStatistic and $issue.currentEstimateStatistic and $issue.estimateStatistic.statFieldValue.text != $issue.currentEstimateStatistic.statFieldValue.text} {call .renderChangedEstimateIndicator} {param initialEstimate: $issue.estimateStatistic.statFieldValue.text /} {param currentEstimate: $issue.currentEstimateStatistic.statFieldValue.text /} {/call} {else} {$issue.estimateStatistic.statFieldValue.text} {/if} {code} When attempting to render an issue without an $issue.estimateStatistic , $issue.estimateStatistic.statFieldValue.text cannot be read.
fields.summary: Release Burndown report doesn't render data table when it includes issues without estimation statistics

fields.description:
* As an admin, I create a Software>Kanban project, setting project lead to another user.
* The Kanban project template creates a new Kanban agile board for this project

Actual Result:
* The Board Administrator is assigned to me (the global admin)

Expected Result:
* The Board Administrator is assigned to the project lead.
fields.summary: Project lead for a new project with board should be added as a board administrator

fields.description: Like we know who closed the sprint? Do we have place to know who started the sprint and when
fields.summary: Who started the sprint?

fields.description:
The Velocity Cart calculates Completed issues as the sum total of all story points completed in a sprint even if they are removed from the sprint. 

The Sprint Report only considers issues that were completed within the sprint and excludes those that were removed.

It would be great of the user could apply the same method used in the Sprint Report to the Velocity Chart via a toggle button or other such functionality.
fields.summary: Velocity Chart Improvement

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
While it's possible to get the *Average time in status* and the *Control chart*, it's not currently possible to obtain a report showing the average cycle time based on their statuses for specific projects/components.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be handy to have something in between: an average based on more than just 1 status, as for example "how long in average it takes for the statuses approved and in progress".
fields.summary: Show the average cycle time based on their statuses

fields.description:
h3. Summary
_Sprint Burndown gadget_ does not load any data on the dashboard.
Sometimes it's possible to make it load, but it's intermittent and doesn't seems to have anything else related.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.0.0-OD-08-002

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add _Sprint Burndown gadget_ to the dashboard
# In gadget's configuration, select the board with the current active Sprint and _refresh interval_ is 15 minutes, Save.

h3. Expected Results
The gadget should load the data

h3. Actual Results
The gadget does not load any data (blank)
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
# If you are the owner of the Dashboard: Click _Edit -> Cancel_ on the gadget configuration.
# If you are not, you can either:
-- Copy that dashboard and then click _Edit -> Cancel_ button Or
-- Ask the owner of the board to change the _Refresh Interval_ of the gadget to _15 minutes_, the data will be loaded after 15 minutes.

*Notes:*
This happens mainly on Google Chrome, also verified in Safari and IE.
Firefox can be used instead.
fields.summary: Sprint Burndown gadget does not load any data
Unable to update closed sprint via REST API

fields.description: {{As an administrator I would like to have JIRA Software source code available to download.}}
fields.summary: Availability of JIRA Software source code

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After installing JIRA Software 7.0.2 and navigating to _Administration>>Applications>>Versions and licenses_ page, the following message is displayed : 

"JIRA Software 7.0.0 is now available."



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a fresh JIRA Software
# Navigate to _Administration>>Applications>>Versions and licenses_ page

h3. Expected Results
No upgrade note would be displayed as its the highest available version for now.

h3. Actual Results
A note for upgrading to 7.0.0 is displayed.
 
h3. Notes
The issue is not reproducible for JIRA Core.
fields.summary: After installing JIRA Software 7.0.2 "Versions and licenses" page displays "JIRA Software 7.0.0 is now available"

fields.description: Hello, i want the possibility to rank my issues on my board without disrupting the rank in other baords. My board consists of a filter that brings multiple projects together in one board..
fields.summary: One Board multiple projects vs rank

fields.description:
The following documentation:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACLOUD/Managing+Global+Permissions

is explaining _JIRA Users_ Global Permission which is not applicable in JIRA On-Demand.
fields.summary: JIRA Users global permission is not applicable to JIRA On-Demand

fields.description: It will be great if the epic progress bar (same as at the planning board) will be viewable on the agile board.
fields.summary: Ability to show Epic progress bar on agile cards

fields.description: As a Kanban user who uses Epics for tagging JIRAs on my Kanban board I want the ability to rename epics in Kanban projects (in contrast to https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/working-with-epics/editing-or-renaming-an-epic's saying "This page only applies to Scrum boards."). The way I work around this now is I move the Epic to a project on a Scrum board and then move it back.
fields.summary: rename epics in Kanban projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment the version length on the JIRA Software boards is 25 characters. We would like to have have versions for longer length. From Administration>>Project>>Versions screen, it is possible to add versions upto 255 characters.


h3. Suggested Solution
Allow versions upto 255 characters to be created from Boards as well.

 
h3. Workaround 
Create versions from Administration>>Project>>Versions screen.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to increase the length of fix version field on Rapid boards

fields.description:
Hi,
We are using JIRA 6.4 and it is not possible to sort backlog without using ranking option. We have talked to your support and he explained that it cannot be done with this version and ranking's purpose is to sort backlogs. Can sorting items without ranking be added as a new feature?
Best Regards
fields.summary: sorting backlog items without using ranking in Jira Agile

fields.description: I added a new custom issue type to a project's Issue Type Scheme. There is only one default Field Configuration for all issue types in this project. However, when I edited an existing issue to use this new type, its existing, populated Story Points field disappeared, requiring me to re-enter the estimate for this issue.
fields.summary: Changing issue type removes Story Points

fields.description: It would be great to see connections to Docker images | containers within a JIRA issue. Though with Bamboo and Bitbucket integration, it's easily possible to follow a JIRA issue and find out builds, deployments and related Docker integrations, it would be helpful to see this information for non-Bitbucket and Bamboo users in a JIRA issue.
fields.summary: The ability to see related Docker containers in a JIRA issue
A field depend to the result of  another field

fields.description:
Problem definition:
As blind user I'm using a screen reader (JAWS). When creating a new jira I can't choose from the list of epics, because the screen reader doesn't read
in the list. I'm using a server version of Jira.

Proposed solution:
The epics to appear in a combo-box, it would be much easier to select it.
fields.summary: The screen reader doesn't read the list of epics

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition
In many use-cases, stories and other chile issues of epic may share common values for certain fields, there is currently no facility available in JIRA to copy values over from parent epic or other linked issues e.g. copying over fix version from parent Epic.

h2. Suggested Solution
Provide facility to copy over field values from Epics or other linked issues.

h2. Workaround
Third party solution available with https://innovalog.atlassian.net/wiki/display/JMWE/Post-functions#Post-functions-8-CopyFieldValuetoLinkedIssuesFunction(newin3.0)
fields.summary: Provide facility to copy over field values from linked issues e.g. fix version from parent Epic

fields.description:
h4. Improvement
Add a Bamboo post-function to JIRA so when an issue is transitioned, a Bamboo build can be triggered or scheduled via cron.

h4. Benefit
All code tracking can be kept and controlled in one place with a holistic history of the issue.
fields.summary: Add post function for scheduling Bamboo builds
